definition: square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: The mother licked the child for failing the examination.
sentences.chinese: 母親因孩子考試不及格而打了他。

sentences.english: In school teach him it is far more honourable to fail than to cheat.
sentences.chinese: 教他求學時不及格比作弊來得剛正。

sentences.english: I become phenomenon, moral fail, always have good ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我成爲現象，思想品德不及格，總比沒思想好。

sentences.english: I'm worried that I will fail in the examination.
sentences.chinese: 這個女孩考試不及格使家長深感憂慮。

sentences.english: I flunked math in second grade.
sentences.chinese: 我二年級時數學不及格。

sentences.english: Wendy did very well in her math exam.
sentences.chinese: 溫迪一年級的數學考試不及格。

sentences.english: Otherwise they might fail the test, and it would be a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 否則它們可能會考試不及格，而這將是一個災難。

sentences.english: Bill doesn't give a hoot whether he passes his examination or not.
sentences.chinese: 比爾對考試及格還是不及格一點都不在乎。

sentences.english: So you are like flunk us if we don't change the world?
sentences.chinese: 要是我們不改變世界，你會讓我們不及格？

sentences.english: Tom is too hard-working not to pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆這麼用功，哪有考不及格的道理。

sentences.english: Her father helped her out when she failed the test.
sentences.chinese: 她考試不及格時，媽媽幫她走出困境。

sentences.english: It is critical those you absorbing exert for the exam or you will fail it.
sentences.chinese: 爲了考好你必需用功溫習，則你會不及格的。

sentences.english: I failed the test despite studying all night.
sentences.chinese: 儘管整夜學習，我還是考試不及格。

sentences.english: Benny makes a face whenever he fails a quiz.
sentences.chinese: 貝尼考試不及格就扮鬼臉。

definition: to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
passing line or score (in an examination)
to sit for a makeup exam/to resit an exam/makeup exam/resit
to repeat a year in school
to overemphasize some topic (at the expense of others)/overdoing it/to go overboard
to deduct marks (when grading school work)/to have marks deducted/penalty points/to lose points for a penalty or error
